title: wtsimis
author: wtsimis
content: I am using Freebitco.in since the last 6 months (not frequently). I just daily spin, and after months I acquire 533 fun tokens. I always want to have the premium membership, so that I can claim 3/4 daily spin daily. Since the price of the fun tokens is comparatively low now, so I'm planning to buy more than 4500(35$) fun tokens to claim 3 spins daily. Now, Is it profitable in the long term to have a Freebitco.in a premium account?

comments.author: limmurk
comments.body: It depends on what you call long term. You'll get your investment back in the long run. 4500 token x 39 satoshi = 175500 satoshiYou'll get around 50 satoshi daily on average, so it's starting to be profitable after 10 years.

comments.author: k00l1
comments.body: Quote from: limmurk on June 18, 2022, 01:00:02 PMIt depends on what you call long term. You'll get your investment back in the long run. 4500 token x 39 satoshi = 175500 satoshiYou'll get around 50 satoshi daily on average, so it's starting to be profitable after 10 years.you can also lock your token to get additional return

comments.author: limmurk
comments.body: Quote from: k00l1 on June 18, 2022, 03:50:55 PMQuote from: limmurk on June 18, 2022, 01:00:02 PMIt depends on what you call long term. You'll get your investment back in the long run. 4500 token x 39 satoshi = 175500 satoshiYou'll get around 50 satoshi daily on average, so it's starting to be profitable after 10 years.you can also lock your token to get additional returnYup, and a million other things (bigger annual interest, staking and selling fun, multiply, lottery...) I was just talking about worst case scenario.
